title: TypeDesign: Tools & Books
content:
I’am a graphic designer and in near future i’am considering to create a Font. So i have to watch out for good design-tools - I know TypeTool, but what you think about FontLab?

I used TypeTool to integrate some customer logos - but i guess to create a proffessional font i need a stronger tool.

my second question is about Typedesign knowledge - are there any books available about this topic?

can anybody give me some tips!

thanks a lot, alex

 [‹ All in one typeface for newspaper](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830093021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36362 "Go to previous forum topic") [help choosing a sans-serif for environmentally friendly design group ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830093021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39122 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ag_alexgrimm

comments.content:
LontLab is the application a lot of professional typedesigners use.

For books on typedesign, search typophile. [I did a search for you here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830093021/http:/www.google.com/search?hl=nl&q=site%3Atypophile.com+books+on+typedesign&btnG=Zoeken&lr=).  
Or check [http://typophile.com/books](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830093021/http:/typophile.com/books "http://typophile.com/books").

have a look at “designing type” by karen cheng:

› [_designing type_ – english edition](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830093021/http:/www.amazon.com/Designing-Type-Karen-Cheng/dp/0300111509)  
› [_anatomie der buchstaben_ – german edition](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830093021/http:/www.amazon.de/Anatomie-Buchstaben-Basiswissen-Schriftgestalter-Designing/dp/3874396894)  
› [_disear tipograﬁa_ – spanish edition](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830093021/http:/www.amazon.com/Disear-Tipografia-Karen-Cheng/dp/8425220726)

ulli.

Have you already looked at the Resources on Typophile?
